bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an income support payment under the Canada Emergency Response Benefit Act;
a benefit under the Canada Recovery Benefits Act;
employment insurance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 6 of Schedule D is to be read as though it also provided that no deduction is to be made for the following when calculating the maximum amount of hardship assistance for which an applicant's family unit is eligible under section 2 of that Schedule:

a benefit under the Canada Recovery Benefits Act;
employment insurance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section is repealed on March 1, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The eligibility of a family unit for disability assistance must be assessed on the basis of the 2-stage process set out in sections 4.1 and 4.2, unless the eligibility of the family unit is re-established in accordance with the process set out in section 4.4.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Re-establishment of eligibility for disability assistance

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may re-establish eligibility for disability assistance in accordance with subsection (2) if disability assistance has been provided to or for a family unit in a calendar year, but the family unit becomes ineligible under section 9 [limits on income] during that calendar year because the qualifying income of the family unit determined under section 3 of Schedule B equals or exceeds the amount of disability assistance determined under Schedule A that applies to a family unit matching that family unit.

The eligibility of the family unit referred to in subsection (1) for disability assistance may be re-established based on monthly reports submitted under section 29.1 [voluntary reporting] during the period of ineligibility for disability assistance during the calendar year in which the family unit becomes ineligible.

If monthly reports under section 29.1 have not been submitted in respect of a family unit referred to in subsection (1), the 2-stage process set out in sections 4.1 and 4.2 applies to the family unit for the re-establishment of eligibility.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: assignment means an assignment of maintenance rights to the minister;

subsection.subsectiontext: The requirement to assign maintenance rights does not apply to any person in a family unit who is not in a category described in section 6 (2) (a) to (f) [citizenship requirements].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Categories of persons who must assign maintenance rights

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a family unit to be eligible for disability assistance or hardship assistance, an applicant or recipient in the family unit who is in any of the following categories and who has for himself or herself or for a dependant a maintenance right described in section 18 [categories of maintenance rights] must disclose and assign, in the form specified by the minister, that maintenance right to the minister:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a spouse;
a spouse who has one or more dependent children from a former relationship;
a person who has never been a spouse and has one or more dependent children;
a person under 19 years of age who is not residing with his or her parents;
a spouse

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who has one or more children from a former relationship who no longer are dependent children, and
is owed arrears under a maintenance order or maintenance agreement in respect of one or more of those children;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: has never been a spouse,
has one or more children who no longer are dependent children, and
is owed arrears under a maintenance order or maintenance agreement in respect of one or more of those children.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The requirement to assign maintenance rights applies to each person in the family unit who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is a person described in section 6 (2) [citizenship requirements], other than a dependent child referred to in paragraph (g) of that section, or
is a person described in section 6.1 (2) (a) [exemption from citizenship requirements].

change.changenote: Section 17 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 35/2020, effective February 28, 2020.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant or recipient who has or may have in the future a maintenance right for himself or herself or for a dependant may, with the consent of the minister, assign the maintenance right to the minister.

change.changenote: Section 18 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 62/2015, effective May 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following categories of maintenance rights must be assigned to the minister:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the right to make an application under an enactment of British Columbia for a maintenance order;
the right to enter into a maintenance agreement;
the right to make or defend an application for variation of a maintenance agreement or maintenance order;
the right to receive payment under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a maintenance agreement or maintenance order, or
a maintenance order made under the Divorce Act (Canada) or otherwise;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the right to enforce a maintenance agreement or maintenance order;
the right to file a maintenance agreement with a court in British Columbia;
the right to file an extra-provincial maintenance order with a court in British Columbia;
the right to file or withdraw a maintenance order under the Family Maintenance Enforcement Act;
the right to make payment arrangements with the debtor for the recovery of arrears.

change.changenote: Section 20 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 62/2015, effective May 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How long an assignment is in effect

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An assignment under this Division ends when

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the assignor no longer receives disability assistance or hardship assistance,
all disability assistance and hardship assistance provided to the assignor's family unit in place of maintenance has been recovered by the minister, and
the assignor receives notice from the minister that the assignment has ended.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), an assignment under this Division that would otherwise have ended under subsection (1) continues in force if the minister and assignor agree in writing to the continuation.
An assignment under this Division that is continued under subsection (2) ends if the minister or the assignor delivers written notice by ordinary mail to the other of the termination.

If an assignor no longer receives disability assistance or hardship assistance and amounts owing to the government under this Division still remain unrecovered, then, despite section 18 [categories of maintenance rights], only the following maintenance rights remain in effect under the assignment:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the right to withdraw a maintenance order under the Family Maintenance Enforcement Act;
the right to receive payment of maintenance arrears that are owed to the government under an assignment;
the right to defend an application to reduce or cancel arrears of maintenance owed to the government;
the right to make arrangements with the debtor for payment of arrears of maintenance owed to the government;
the right to enforce the maintenance order with respect to arrears owed to the government.

change.changenote: Section 21 (c) (iv) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 149/2010, effective June 1, 2010.

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: providing the court file number and style of cause of any maintenance orders in existence;

change.changenote: Section 21 (c) (ii) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 364/2012, effective March 18, 2013.

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: providing the names, ages and custody or residency arrangements of all children of the union,

change.changenote: Section 21 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 62/2015, effective May 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Terms to be included in the assignment
bcl:section.bcl:text: An assignment under this Division must include all of the following terms:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the assignment of the categories of maintenance rights set out in section 18 [categories of maintenance rights];
authorization by the assignor that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the minister may provide to the director of maintenance enforcement any information necessary for the filing, enforcement and monitoring of payments made under the assignor's maintenance order,
the director of maintenance enforcement may provide to the minister

bcl:clause.bcl:text: any information that affects eligibility for disability assistance or hardship assistance, and
information about the payment, monitoring or enforcement of the assignor's maintenance order,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the minister may obtain or search court documents required to exercise the rights assigned,

the minister may provide to the child support service any information necessary for the purpose of recalculating child support under a maintenance agreement or a maintenance order that is assigned to the minister, and
the child support service may provide to the minister any information regarding the recalculation of child support under a maintenance agreement or maintenance order that is assigned to the minister;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: agreement by the assignor to cooperate with the minister and the director of maintenance enforcement as necessary to obtain, vary or enforce the assignor's maintenance agreement or maintenance order including

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: providing any information and verifications relating to the debtor's name, address, employer and salary,
providing the names, ages and custody, guardianship or residency arrangements of all children of the union,
attending at all appointments, meetings and court proceedings relating to the assigned rights when requested to do so by the minister or the director of maintenance enforcement, and
providing the court file number and style of proceeding of any maintenance orders in existence;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: agreement by the assignor to cooperate with the minister and the child support service as necessary for the purpose of recalculating child support;
acknowledgment by the assignor that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: he or she cannot take any of the actions or enter any agreements related to maintenance that are set out in the assignment as long as the assignment to the minister is in effect, unless authorized in writing by the minister, and that to do so without authorization will affect the assignor's eligibility for disability assistance or hardship assistance,

if legal counsel for the government has brought or is defending a proceeding on the assignor's behalf, the legal counsel is solely counsel for the government and there is no solicitor-client relationship between that counsel and the assignor,
only the minister can forgive, reduce or otherwise vary arrears of maintenance owed to the government, and
no agreement to cancel or reduce arrears owed to the assignor under the assignor's maintenance agreement or maintenance order will be made by the government without the assignor's consent;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the assignment will continue in effect after the assignor no longer receives disability assistance or hardship assistance if there are still arrears of maintenance unrecovered by the government and, so long as there are arrears, the assignor acknowledges that only the government is entitled to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: withdraw a maintenance order under the Family Maintenance Enforcement Act,
receive payment of maintenance arrears that are owed to the government under an assignment,
defend an application to reduce or cancel arrears of maintenance owed to the government,
make arrangements with the debtor for payment of arrears of maintenance owed to the government, and
enforce the maintenance order with respect to arrears owed to the government;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the assignment ceases to have effect when

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: disability assistance and hardship assistance are no longer provided to the assignor's family unit and there are no arrears unrecovered by the government, and
a written notice of termination of the assignment is sent to the assignor at the last known address of the assignor shown on record with the ministry.

change.changenote: Section 22 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 62/2015, effective May 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Failure to comply with terms of assignment

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an assignor who is receiving disability assistance or hardship assistance fails to comply with the terms of an assignment referred to in section 21 (c) [terms to be included in the assignment], the assignor's family unit may be declared ineligible for disability assistance or hardship assistance.
This section does not apply if the minister is satisfied that the failure of the assignor to comply with the terms of the assignment is beyond the control of the assignor.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disability assistance in the form of transportation support allowance

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide to or for a family unit, for a calendar month, in respect of each applicant or recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities in the family unit, one of the following forms of transportation support allowance:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in money, in the amount of $52;

in kind, in the form of a monthly pass for the personal use of the person with disabilities to use a public passenger transportation system in a transit service area established under section 25 of the British Columbia Transit Act, or in a transportation service region as defined in the South Coast British Columbia Transportation Authority Act, which is deemed to have a value in the amount of $52 for the purposes of this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an applicant or recipient who is provided a transportation support allowance under either paragraph (a) or (b) of subsection (1) gives the minister notice that the recipient wishes to be provided the other form of transportation support allowance provided under that subsection, the minister may provide that other form of transportation support allowance for a subsequent month.

If the amount of disability assistance calculated in respect of a family unit under section 24 is less than the applicable amount for the family unit's transportation support allowance, disability assistance may be provided in accordance with this section up to an amount equal to the applicable amount for the family unit's transportation support allowance.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Effect on Eligibility of Convictions or Admissions

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 14 (5) (b) [consequences for conviction or judgment] of the Act, assistance provided for a calendar month to or for a family unit that includes one or more persons who have been convicted under the Criminal Code in relation to obtaining money under the Act or the Employment and Assistance Act by fraud or false or misleading representation must be reduced

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit includes a sole applicant, or a sole recipient, who has been convicted as described, and one or more dependent children, by $100,
if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, only one of whom has been convicted as described, and no dependent children, by $300,
if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, only one of whom has been convicted as described, and one or more dependent children, by $100, and
if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, both of whom have been convicted as described, and one or more dependent children, by $200.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Convictions under the Act or the Employment and Assistance Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 14 (5) (b) [consequences for conviction or judgment] of the Act, assistance provided for a calendar month to or for a family unit that includes one or more persons who have been convicted of an offence under the Act or the Employment and Assistance Act must be reduced for the applicable period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit includes a sole applicant, or a sole recipient, who has been convicted as described, and one or more dependent children, by $100,
if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, only one of whom has been convicted as described, and no dependent children, by $300,
if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, only one of whom has been convicted as described, and one or more dependent children, by $100,
if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, both of whom have been convicted as described, and one or more dependent children, by $200.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Declaration under section 14 (3) of the Act respecting judgment
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the minister has made a declaration under section 14 (3) [consequences for conviction or judgment] of the Act in respect of a family unit, for the purposes of section 14 (5) of the Act, the family unit's assistance for a calendar month must be discontinued or reduced as follows for the period specified

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit includes only one or more applicants, or recipients, who have had judgment given against them, and includes no dependent children, the family unit is not eligible for disability assistance,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: after a first judgment, for 3 calendar months,
after a second judgment, for 6 calendar months, and
after a third or subsequent judgment, for 12 calendar months;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit includes a sole applicant or sole recipient who has had judgment given against him or her, and includes one or more dependent children, the assistance provided to or for the family unit must be reduced by $100

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: after a first judgment, for 3 calendar months,
after a second judgment, for 6 calendar months, and
after a third or subsequent judgment, for 12 calendar months;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, only one of whom has had judgment given against him or her, and includes no dependent children, the assistance provided to or for the family unit must be reduced by $300

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: after a first judgment, for 3 calendar months,
after a second judgment, for 6 calendar months, and
after a third or subsequent judgment, for 12 calendar months;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, only one of whom has had judgment given against him or her, and includes one or more dependent children, the assistance provided to or for the family unit must be reduced by $100

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: after a first judgment, for 3 calendar months,
after a second judgment, for 6 calendar months, and
after a third or subsequent judgment, for 12 calendar months;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit includes two applicants or recipients, both of whom have had judgment given against them, and includes one or more dependent children, the assistance provided to or for the family unit must be reduced by $200

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: after a first judgment, for 3 calendar months,
after a second judgment, for 6 calendar months, and
after a third or subsequent judgment, for 12 calendar months.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consequences for conviction, etc. under a former Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: benefit month means a month for which, but for this section or a declaration under this section, a family unit would otherwise be eligible for disability assistance or a supplement, and
the 3 benefit months referred to in subsections (2) and (3) need not be consecutive.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The family unit of an applicant or recipient is not eligible for disability assistance or supplements for 3 benefit months if the applicant or recipient

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: was convicted of an offence under section 22 (1) of the BC Benefits (Income Assistance) Act, section 11 (1) of the Disability Benefits Program Act or section 13 (1) of the BC Benefits (Youth Works) Act, as those provisions read immediately before their repeal, or
was convicted of an offence under the Criminal Code in relation to obtaining, by fraud or false or misleading representations, money under a former Act or the BC Benefits (Youth Works) Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may declare a family unit ineligible for disability assistance or supplements for 3 benefit months if a court gives judgment in favour of the government in an action for debt against an applicant or a recipient in the family unit for money obtained under a former Act or the BC Benefits (Youth Works) Act to which he or she was not entitled, unless the money was paid in error.
No family unit is, or may be declared, ineligible under this section on the basis of a conviction secured or a judgment given before March 13, 1997.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: base amount has the same meaning as in section 3 of Schedule B;
qualifying income has the same meaning as in section 3 of Schedule B.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide hardship assistance to a family unit that is not eligible for disability assistance because the family unit does not satisfy the requirement under section 6 (1) [citizenship requirements] or 6.1 (1) [exemption from citizenship requirements] if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister considers that undue hardship will otherwise occur, and

the family unit includes a person who is in Canada under a temporary resident visa under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (Canada) that was issued through an emergency authorization process for humanitarian reasons related to armed conflict.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 6 does not apply in respect of hardship assistance under this section.

For the purposes of hardship assistance under this section, section 6 of Schedule D is to be read as though it also provided that no deduction is to be made for the following when calculating the maximum amount of hardship assistance for which an applicant's family unit is eligible under section 2 of that Schedule:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: income that, because of the armed conflict, is not immediately available to meet the family unit's basic needs;
subject to subsection (5), qualifying income in a calendar month that is less than or equal to the base amount for the family unit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A family unit may not claim an exemption under subsection (4) (b) in relation to the first calendar month for which the family unit becomes eligible for hardship assistance under this section unless a member of the family unit received income assistance, disability assistance or hardship assistance under this regulation or the Employment and Assistance Regulation in at least one of the 6 calendar months immediately preceding that first calendar month.

change.changenote: Section 42 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 149/2015, effective August 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Family units ineligible or declared ineligible under section 34 [consequences for conviction, etc. under a former Act]
bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may provide hardship assistance to a family unit that is ineligible or declared ineligible under section 34 [consequences for conviction, etc. under a former Act] if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the family unit includes one or more dependent children,
the minister considers that undue hardship will otherwise occur, and
the applicant provides the type of security specified by the minister for the repayment of the hardship assistance.

change.changenote: Section 42.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 149/2015, effective August 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Family units ineligible or declared ineligible in relation to convictions or judgments

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the circumstances described in subsection (2), the minister may provide hardship assistance to a family unit that under section 14 (5) (a) [consequences for conviction or judgment in relation to Act] of the Act is not eligible for disability assistance because it includes only

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: persons convicted of an offence under the Criminal Code, this Act or the Employment and Assistance Act in relation to obtaining money under this Act or the Employment and Assistance Act by fraud or false or misleading representation,
persons convicted of an offence under this Act or the Employment and Assistance Act, or
persons in respect of whom

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a court has given judgment in favour of the government in an action for debt for obtaining disability assistance, hardship assistance or a supplement under this Act or income assistance, hardship assistance or a supplement under the Employment and Assistance Act, for which he or she was not eligible, and
the minister has made a declaration under section 14 (3) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide hardship assistance to a family unit described in subsection (1) if the minister considers that otherwise

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the family unit will experience undue hardship, and
the physical health of a person in the family unit will be in imminent danger.

change.changenote: Section 42.2 was enacted by BC Reg 270/2019, effective January 20, 2020.
Section 42.2 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 21/2023, effective March 1, 2023.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If hardship assistance is provided to a family unit, the family unit is not required to repay the amount of the hardship assistance, if any, that is calculated in accordance with section 5 (c.1) of Schedule D as it pertains to section 8 (1) of Schedule A.

change.changenote: Section 43 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 270/2019, effective January 20, 2020.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: To enable the family unit of a recipient of disability assistance to obtain residential accommodation, the minister may provide a lump sum to or for the family unit for the purchase of membership shares in a cooperative housing association.

change.changenote: Section 43.1 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 73/2010, effective June 1, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: The sole recipient is eligible to receive the pre-natal shelter supplement while she is pregnant, as confirmed in writing by a medical practitioner or a registrant of the College of Midwives of British Columbia.

change.changenote: Section 43.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 270/2019, effective January 20, 2020.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide a pre-natal shelter supplement in accordance with section 4 (6) of Schedule A if the supplement is provided to a sole recipient without dependants who is a recipient of disability assistance under section 2 [monthly support allowance], 4 [monthly shelter allowance] or 6 [people receiving room and board] of Schedule A.

The sole recipient is eligible to receive the pre-natal shelter supplement while she is pregnant, as confirmed in writing by a medical practitioner, nurse practitioner or a registrant of the College of Midwives of British Columbia.

change.changenote: Section 44 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 270/2019, effective January 20, 2020.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide an annual Christmas supplement to or for a family unit that is eligible for disability assistance.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount to be provided as a Christmas supplement, which may be different for different categories of family units, and
the time when the supplement is to be provided.

change.changenote: Section 45 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 196/2012, effective July 3, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister may provide an annual school start-up supplement to or for a family unit that is eligible for disability assistance if the family unit includes a dependent child who is attending school full time.
The minister may specify

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount to be provided as a school start-up supplement, which may be different for different age groups of children, and
the time when the supplement is to be provided.

change.changenote: Section 47 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 148/2011, effective August 9, 2011.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister may provide to or for a family unit that is eligible for disability assistance a supplement of up to $100 for each calendar month for each recipient or dependent child who has reached 15 years of age for clothing, transportation or other expenses that are needed for that recipient or dependent child to participate in a community volunteer program.
Subsection (1) does not apply for a calendar month in which the minister provides the family unit with a supplement under

paragraph.paragraphtext: section 48 [monthly incentive supplement], for the use or benefit of that recipient or dependent child,
section 49 [training initiative supplement], for the use or benefit of that recipient or dependent child, or
section 54 (2) [supplements related to employment plan], for the use or benefit of that recipient or dependent child.

change.changenote: Section 48 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 148/2011, effective August 9, 2011.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister may provide an incentive supplement to or for a family unit that is eligible for disability assistance to enable a recipient to participate in a vocational, self-improvement or other program to prepare the recipient for employment.
The following is the amount of an incentive supplement:

paragraph.paragraphtext: $50 for each calendar month for a recipient if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit does not include a dependent child, and
the recipient does a minimum of 20 hours of work experience in the previous calendar month;

paragraph.paragraphtext: $100 for each calendar month for a recipient if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit includes a dependent child, and
the recipient does a minimum of 40 hours of work experience in the previous calendar month.

subsection.subsectiontext: Only 6 monthly payments may be made to a family unit under this section on account of a particular recipient over a period of 36 consecutive months, beginning with the month in which the supplement was first provided to or for the family unit on account of that recipient.
No supplement may be provided under this section for a recipient who is receiving a supplement under section 47 [community volunteer supplement] or section 49 [training initiative supplement].

change.changenote: Section 49 (4) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 148/2011, effective August 9, 2011.

subsection.subsectiontext: No supplement may be provided under this section in respect of a person for whom a supplement is being provided under section 47 [community volunteer supplement] or section 48 [monthly incentive supplement].

change.changenote: Section 50 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 270/2019, effective January 20, 2020.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Clothing supplement for people in specified special care facilities

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide a supplement, for the purchase of necessary clothing, to a person with disabilities who is eligible for disability assistance and receives accommodation and care in a special care facility if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: clothing is not provided in the facility,
there are no funds available from the recipient's comforts allowance to purchase the clothing, and
there are no resources available to the recipient's family unit to pay for the clothing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply if the special care facility is an alcohol and drug treatment centre or a special care facility described in section 8 (3) of Schedule A.

change.changenote: Section 50.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 270/2019, effective January 20, 2020.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transportation to special care facilities supplement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the minister may provide a supplement to a recipient who is eligible for disability assistance for transportation to a special care facility that is an alcohol or drug treatment centre.
A supplement may be provided under this section only

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the recipient receives the minister's approval before incurring the transportation costs,
if there are no resources available to the recipient's family unit to cover the transportation costs, and
for the least expensive appropriate mode of transportation.

change.changenote: Section 51 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 175/2016, effective September 1, 2016.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide a supplement to or for a family unit that is eligible for disability assistance and contributes $45 to the cost to provide an annual pass for the personal use of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person with disabilities in the family unit, or
the spouse of that person if that spouse

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is 60 or more years of age,
receives the federal spouse's allowance or federal guaranteed income supplement, or
is 65 years of age or more and meets all of the eligibility requirements for the federal guaranteed income supplement except the 10 year residency requirement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, annual pass means an annual pass to use a public passenger transportation system in a transit service area established under section 25 of the British Columbia Transit Act.

change.changenote: Section 52 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 270/2019, effective January 20, 2020.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this section a reconsideration or appeal is determined when

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a decision of the minister or a decision of the tribunal has been made in the reconsideration or appeal, if the decision can be implemented without a further decision as to amount, or
if a decision of the tribunal requires a further decision of the minister as to amount, the decision of the minister as to amount has been made.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may provide a supplement to or for a family unit that is eligible for disability assistance if a recipient in the family unit delivers a request for a reconsideration under section 71 [how a request to reconsider a decision is made] or an appeal form under section 84 [commencing an appeal] of the Employment and Assistance Regulation in respect of a decision that resulted in a discontinuation or reduction of disability assistance or a supplement but only if the recipient agrees in writing to repay the amount of the supplement paid under this section.
A supplement under this section may be provided for the shorter of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the period between the date a request or appeal form is delivered and the date that the reconsideration or appeal is determined, and
the period between the date the disability assistance or supplement was reduced or discontinued and the date that the reconsideration or appeal is determined.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A supplement under this section is limited to the following amounts:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the request for a reconsideration or the appeal form is in respect of a decision that resulted in a discontinuation of disability assistance or a supplement, the amount of the discontinued disability assistance or supplement;

if the request for a reconsideration or the appeal form is in respect of a decision that resulted in a reduction of disability assistance or a supplement, the amount by which the disability assistance or supplement was reduced.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the determination of a reconsideration or appeal that rescinds the decision being reconsidered or appealed did not require a further decision of the minister as to amount, the amount of a supplement provided under this section is not repayable and must be considered to have been paid in place of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the discontinued disability assistance or supplement, or
the amount by which the disability assistance or supplement was reduced.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the determination of a reconsideration or appeal that rescinds the decision being reconsidered or appealed required a further decision of the minister as to amount, the recipient must repay the difference between

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total amount paid to the recipient under this section for the period under subsection (3), and
the total amount of any adjustment in favour of the recipient under the determination for the same period.

change.changenote: Part 5, division 2 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 122/2019, effective July 1, 2019.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Supplements — Family Unit Eligible for Hardship Assistance

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Supplement to obtain proof of identity
bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may provide a supplement to or for a family unit that is eligible for hardship assistance to cover the cost of obtaining proof of the identity of a person in the family unit that is required for the family unit to be eligible for disability assistance.

section.marginalnote: Advance for delayed or suspended family bonus

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister may provide a supplement to or for a family unit that is eligible for disability assistance or hardship assistance as an advance for delayed, cancelled or suspended family bonus if

paragraph.paragraphtext: payment of the BC basic family bonus to a person in the family unit is delayed, cancelled or suspended under the Income Tax Act (Canada) or the Income Tax Act (British Columbia) for any reason other than that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the person refuses to apply for the family bonus,
the person refuses to provide information necessary to determine eligibility for family bonus, or
the person refuses to accept the family bonus, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the minister considers that the advance is immediately needed for basic needs of food, clothing or shelter.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (3), the amount that may be advanced as a supplement under subsection (1) is not more than $123.50 for each dependent child in the family unit for whom a person in the family unit appears to be entitled to the BC basic family bonus.

The amount determined under subsection (2) is reduced by the amount of the national child benefit supplement received for the calendar month preceding the calendar month for which the advance is paid for each child referred to in that subsection.
Before advancing any amount to a recipient, the minister may require that the recipient agree in writing to repay the amount advanced minus

paragraph.paragraphtext: any amount a recipient in the family unit is eligible for under section 2 (2) (b) of Schedule A or section 2 (2) (b) of Schedule D in respect of the delayed or suspended BC basic family bonus, and
any amount deducted under section 10 of Schedule B or section 2 (3) or (7) of Schedule D in respect of the advance.

An eye examination supplement may only be provided to or for a person once in any 24 calendar month period.
An eye examination supplement may only be provided if payment for the service is not available under the Medicare Protection Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (1.1) and (1.2), the minister may provide a crown and bridgework supplement under section 4.1 of Schedule C to any of the following persons:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a recipient of disability assistance;
a person with disabilities who has not reached 65 years of age and who has ceased to be eligible for disability assistance because of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: employment income earned by the person or the person's spouse, if either the person or the person's spouse

bcl:clause.bcl:text: is under age 65 and the family unit is receiving premium assistance under the Medicare Protection Act, or
is aged 65 or more and a person in the family unit is receiving the federal spouse's allowance or the federal guaranteed income supplement,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a pension or other payment under the Canada Pension Plan (Canada), or
money or value received by the person or the person's spouse that is maintenance under a maintenance order, maintenance agreement or other agreement, if either the person or the person's spouse

bcl:clause.bcl:text: is under age 65 and the family unit is receiving premium assistance under the Medicare Protection Act, or
is aged 65 or more and any person in the family unit is receiving the federal spouse's allowance or the federal guaranteed income supplement;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person with disabilities who was a recipient of disability assistance on the day he or she became 65 years of age;
a person referred to in section 62 (1) (f), if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person is under age 65 and the family unit is receiving premium assistance under the Medicare Protection Act, or
the person is aged 65 or more and any person in the family unit is receiving the federal spouse's allowance or the federal guaranteed income supplement, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person whose family unit ceases to be eligible for disability assistance because of financial assistance provided through an agreement under section 12.3 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, during the term of the agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person eligible to receive a crown and bridgework supplement under subsection (1) (b) (ii) may receive the supplement

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: while any person in the family unit is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under age 65 and receiving a pension or other payment under the Canada Pension Plan, or
aged 65 or more and receiving the federal spouse's allowance or the federal guaranteed income supplement, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a maximum of one year from the date on which the family unit ceased to be eligible for medical services only.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person eligible to receive a crown and bridgework supplement under subsection (1) (c) may receive the supplement

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: while any person in the family unit is receiving the federal spouse's allowance or the federal guaranteed income supplement, and
for a maximum of one year from the date on which the family unit ceased to be eligible for medical services only.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who was eligible to receive a crown and bridgework supplement under subsection (1) (b) (i) or (iii) or (d) but ceases to be eligible for medical services only may continue to receive the supplement for a maximum of one year from the date on which the family unit ceased to be eligible for medical services only.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 67/2010, Sch. 2, s. 5 (f).]

section.marginalnote: Health supplement for persons facing life threatening health need
section.sectiontext: The minister may provide any health supplement set out in Schedule C [health supplements] to a family unit that includes a person with disabilities, if the health supplement is provided to or for a person in the family unit who is otherwise not eligible for the health supplement under this regulation, and if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the person faces a life-threatening health need and there are no resources available to the person's family unit with which to meet that need, and
the minister determines that the health supplement is necessary to meet that need.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition for bus pass supplements — persons with disabilities
bcl:section.bcl:text: An annual pass is deemed to be a transportation support allowance provided in kind under section 24.1 (1) (b) [disability assistance in the form of transportation support allowance] if the annual pass has been provided to or for one of the following applicants or recipients:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an applicant or recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities and was provided an annual pass for personal use under section 51 (1) (a) [bus pass supplement], as it was immediately before the date this section came into force;
an applicant or recipient who becomes designated as a person with disabilities, who was provided an annual pass for personal use

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: as the spouse of a person with disabilities under section 51 (1), or
under section 66 (1) [bus pass supplement] of the Employment and Assistance Regulation, B.C. Reg. 263/2002.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the family unit includes one or more dependent children, the monthly support allowance under subsection (1) is adjusted as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: for each dependent child, by an additional $123.50 for the calendar month in which the dependent child is born;

for each subsequent calendar month, by an additional $123.50.

paragraph.paragraphtext: payment of the family bonus for the preceding calendar month is delayed, cancelled or suspended for any of the reasons listed in section 59 [advance for delayed or suspended family bonus] of this regulation, or
a person in the family unit refuses to accept or apply for the family bonus for the preceding calendar month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the special care facility under subsection (1) is an alcohol or drug treatment centre, the minister may, in addition, pay either or both of the following while the applicant or recipient is in the alcohol or drug treatment centre:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: actual shelter costs for the applicant's or recipient's usual place of residence up to the amount under section 4 for a family unit matching the applicant's or recipient's family unit;

a monthly support allowance for the applicant's or recipient's family unit, equal to the amount calculated under sections 2 and 3 of this Schedule minus the portion of that allowance that would be provided on account of the applicant or recipient.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the actual cost, if any, to the family unit of the accommodation and care at the rate approved by the minister for the type of emergency shelter or transition house, plus
the support allowance calculated under sections 2 and 3 of this Schedule for a family unit matching the family unit of the applicant or recipient.

subsection.subsectiontext: The amount of earned income calculated under subsection (2) is exempt for a family unit if

paragraph.paragraphtext: a recipient in the family unit has been receiving continuously for the 3 calendar months immediately preceding the calendar month for which the exemption is claimed

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: disability assistance under the Act,
income assistance under the Employment and Assistance Act,
disability assistance or income assistance under a former Act,
a youth allowance under the BC Benefits (Youth Works) Act, or
any combination of the assistance and allowances referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iv).

paragraph.paragraphtext: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 369/2002.]

subsection.subsectiontext: The exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies under subsection (1),

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that is composed of one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar month of calculation, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that is composed of two recipients, both of whom are designated as persons with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar month of calculation.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 3 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 332/2012, effective January 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (2), the amount of earned income calculated under subsection (6) is exempt for a family unit.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 3 (2.1) was added by BC Reg 332/2012, effective January 1, 2013.
Schedule B, section 3 (3) (a.1) was added by BC Reg 332/2012, effective January 1, 2013.
Schedule B, section 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 226/2014, effective January 1, 2015

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (2) and (2.1), the amount of earned income calculated under subsection (3) is exempt for a family unit.

If an application for disability assistance (part 2) form is submitted to the minister, the family unit may not claim an exemption under this section in relation to the first calendar month for which the family unit becomes eligible for disability assistance unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a member of the family unit who is designated as a person with disabilities previously received disability assistance under the Act or a former Act, or
a member of the family unit received income assistance under the Employment and Assistance Act for the calendar month immediately preceding that first calendar month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A new family unit described in section 3.1 (3) (b), (4) (b), (10) (b) or (11) (b) that does not provide written notice to the minister in accordance with section 3.1 (3) (c), (4) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c), as applicable, may claim an exemption under this section except in relation to the calendar month in which the new family unit forms.
The exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies under this section is to be calculated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar month of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar month of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar month of calculation.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 3 (1) definition of "base amount", paragraphs (a) to (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 169/2017, effective October 1, 2017.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $800, in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient,
$1 000, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and
$1 600, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities;

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 3 (8) was added by BC Reg 169/2017, effective October 1, 2017.
Schedule B, section 3 (1) definition of "qualifying income", paragraph (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 268/2020, effective November 9, 2020.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: unearned income that is compensation paid under section 29 or 30 of the Workers Compensation Act;

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 3 (1) definition of "base amount" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 268/2020, effective January 1, 2021.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: base amount means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $1 000, in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient,
$1 200, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and
$2 000, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities;

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 3 (8) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 268/2020, effective January 1, 2021.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 3 but subject to this section, the amount of earned income in a calendar year calculated under subsection (2) of this section is exempt for a family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit provides to the minister, on or before January 14 of the calendar year, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to the family unit's earned income in the calendar year,
a recipient in the family unit

clause.clausetext: is designated as a person with disabilities for the consecutive 12 calendar month period, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

is a recipient of disability assistance for the 2 calendar months, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: for at least one calendar month in the 12 calendar month period immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), the family unit reported, under section 29, earned income in an amount that exceeded

clause.clausetext: $500, in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, or
$750, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit provides to the minister, on or before January 14 of the calendar year, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to the family unit's earned income in the calendar year, and
an exemption under this section applied to the family unit's earned income in the immediately preceding calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsections (3) to (16), the exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies for an exemption under this section is calculated as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar year of calculation;

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar year of calculation;

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar year of calculation.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,

includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the earned income of the new family unit in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities

clause.clausetext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

section.subparasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
only one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the earned income of the new family unit in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if the recipient described in paragraph (b) (ii)

clause.clausetext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

section.subparasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
each of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: if only one of the recipients in the new family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

section.parasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the sum of

clause.clausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient who separated, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient who did not separate, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

section.subparasandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

paragraph.paragraphtext: if each of the recipients in the new family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

section.parasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the sum of

clause.clausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which one of the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the other recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

paragraph.paragraphtext: if paragraphs (c) and (d) do not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (c) (i) minus the sum of the earned income of each recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities,

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

section.parasandwich: minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of family unit's earned income

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (c) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

section.parasandwich: minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of the family unit's earned income

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit that includes only one recipient

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

section.parasandwich: minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of the family unit's earned income

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients who are designated as person with disabilities,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

clause.clausetext: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subparasandwich: minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of the following amounts:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the new family unit's earned income in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms;

the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred;

the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients who are designated as person with disabilities,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that did not qualify for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides to the minister, within the calendar month the new family unit forms, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to the family unit's earned income in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

clause.clausetext: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subparasandwich: minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) was, before the forming of the new family unit, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, minus the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the forming of the new family unit, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: new family unit's earned income in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,

includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and that recipient was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
