paragraph.paragraphtext: the new family unit provides to the minister, within the calendar month the new family unit forms, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to the family unit's earned income in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

clause.clausetext: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iii) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred,

section.subparasandwich: minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iii) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which that event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: $200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: new family unit's earned income in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), (4) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c), as applicable, in the case of the spouse who is not designated as a person with disabilities, is deemed to be cancelled;
the recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
immediately before the separation, was ineligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the recipient who is one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
immediately before the separation, was ineligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: a recipient who is one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year, and
includes two recipients, one of whom becomes designated as a person with disabilities during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar year, and

$600 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: Notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), 4 (c), 10 (c) or 11 (c) is deemed not to have been provided unless the notice is affirmed by the signature of each recipient in the family unit.
If a family unit provides notice in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), (4) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c) the family unit may not withdraw the notice.

If a family unit provides notice in accordance with a section set out in Column 1 of the following Table, the family unit is deemed to also provide notice in accordance with the section set out in Column 2 that corresponds with the entry in Column 1, if the family unit has not already provided notice in accordance with that section:

If subsection (19) applies to a notice provided in accordance with this section and that notice is subsequently deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 1 of the following Table, the notice in section 7.2 that was deemed to be provided in accordance with subsection (19) is deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 2:

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 3.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 226/2014, effective January 1, 2015

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 3 but subject to this section, the amount of earned income in a calendar year calculated under subsection (2) of this section is exempt for a family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit provides written notice to the minister on or before January 14 of the calendar year that the exemption under this section applies to the family unit's earned income in the calendar year,
a recipient in the family unit

bcl:clause.bcl:text: is designated as a person with disabilities for the consecutive 12 calendar month period, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

is a recipient of disability assistance for the 2 calendar months, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: for at least one calendar month in the 12 calendar month period immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), the family unit reported, under section 29, earned income in an amount that exceeded

bcl:clause.bcl:text: $500, in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, or
$750, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit provides written notice to the minister on or before January 14 of the calendar year that the exemption under this section applies to the family unit's earned income in the calendar year, and
an exemption under this section applied to the family unit's earned income in the immediately preceding calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (3) to (16), the exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies for an exemption under this section is calculated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar year of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar year of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit's total earned income in the calendar year of calculation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,

includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the earned income of the new family unit in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities

bcl:clause.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
only one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the earned income of the new family unit in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the recipient described in paragraph (b) (ii)

bcl:clause.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
each of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:
if only one of the recipients in the new family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of that recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which that recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the recipient who did not separate for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if each of the recipients in the new family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (12) or (13),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which one of the recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of that recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which that recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the other recipient's separation occurred, minus the earned income of that recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which that recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if paragraphs (c) and (d) do not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (c) (i) minus the sum of the earned income of each recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the sum of the family unit's earned income

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (c) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the sum of the family unit's earned income

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit that includes only one recipient

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the sum of the family unit's earned income

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: one of whom was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was, immediately before the new family unit formed, ineligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of the following amounts:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms;

the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred;

the earned income of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: one of whom was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was, immediately before the new family unit formed, ineligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that did not qualify for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the new family unit's earned income in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and that recipient was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was, immediately before the new family unit formed, ineligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the new family unit's earned income in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: minus the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and

$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the new family unit's earned income in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the earned income of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), (4) (c), (10) (c) or (11) (c), as applicable, in the case of the person who was one of the spouses and is not designated as a person with disabilities, is deemed to be cancelled;
the recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
immediately before the separation, was ineligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the recipient who was one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
immediately before the separation, was ineligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a recipient who was one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the new family unit's earned income for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year, and
includes two recipients, one of whom becomes designated as a person with disabilities during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar year, and

$600 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), 4 (c), 10 (c) or 11 (c) is deemed not to have been provided unless the notice is affirmed by the signature of each recipient in the family unit.
If a family unit provides notice in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (3) (c), (4) (c), (10) (c) or 11 (c) the family unit may not cancel the notice.

If a family unit provides notice in accordance with a section set out in Column 1 of the following Table, the family unit is deemed to also provide notice in accordance with the section set out in Column 2 that corresponds with the entry in Column 1, if the family unit has not already provided notice in accordance with that section:

If subsection (19) applies to a notice provided in accordance with this section and that notice is subsequently deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 1 of the following Table, the notice in section 7.2 that was deemed to be provided in accordance with subsection (19) is deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 2:

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 4 (1) definition of "permitted operating expenses", paragraph (o) was added to by BC Reg 246/2022, effective November 28, 2022.
Schedule D, section 6 (oo.l), (oo.2) and (ss.2) were added by BC Reg 272/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Schedule B section 7 (1) (d.1), (2) and (3) were added by BC Reg 83/2012, effective May 1, 2012.
Schedule B, section 7 (0.1) was added by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
Schedule B, section 7 (1) (d) and (d.1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: a payment made from a trust to or on behalf of a person referred to in section 12 (2) [assets held in trust for person with disabilities] of this regulation if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the payment is applied exclusively to or used exclusively for disability-related costs as defined in section 12 (1) of this regulation, and

the amount of the exemption under subparagraph (i) for all payments that, during a calendar year, are applied exclusively for the costs referred to in paragraph (d) of that definition does not exceed $5 484;

paragraph.paragraphtext: subject to subsection (2), a structured settlement annuity payment made to a person referred to in section 12 (1) of this regulation if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the payment is applied exclusively to or used exclusively for disability-related costs as defined in section 12 (1) of this regulation, and

the amount of the exemption under subparagraph (i) for all payments that, during a calendar year, are applied exclusively for the costs referred to in paragraph (d) of that definition does not exceed $5 484;

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7 (1) (d.2), (d.3) and (f) were added by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
Schedule B, section 7 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subsection (1) (d.1) applies in respect of a person only if

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7 (2.1) was added by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
Schedule B, section 7 (3) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, structured settlement annuity payment means a payment referred to in subsection (2) (b) (iii) made under the annuity contract referred to in that subsection.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7 (1) (d.3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 204/2015, effective December 1, 2015.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (2.1),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a payment made from a trust to or on behalf of a person referred to in section 12 (1) of this regulation,
a structured settlement annuity payment that, subject to subsection (2), is made to a person referred to in section 12 (1) of this regulation, or
money expended by a person referred to in section 12.1 (2) of this regulation from an intended registered disability savings plan or trust

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the payment, structured settlement annuity payment or money is applied exclusively to or used exclusively for disability-related costs to promote independence;

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7 (2.1) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 204/2015, effective December 1, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The maximum amount of the exemption under subsection (1) (d.3) is $8 000 in a calendar year, calculated as the sum of all payments, structured settlement annuity payments and money that, during the calendar year, are applied exclusively to or used exclusively for disability-related costs to promote independence.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7 (1) (g) was added by BC Reg 233/2016, effective October 1, 2016.
Schedule B, section 7 (1) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 52/2023, effective March 1, 2023.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $50 of each monthly Federal Department of Veterans Affairs benefits paid to any person in the family unit;

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7.1 was added by BC Reg 86/2012, effective May 1, 2012.
Schedule B, section 7.1 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Unearned income that is compensation paid under section 29 or 30 of the Workers Compensation Act is exempt for a family unit if a recipient in the family unit has been receiving continuously for the 3 calendar months immediately preceding the calendar month for which the exemption is claimed

paragraph.paragraphtext: disability assistance under the Act,
income assistance under the Employment and Assistance Act, or
any combination of the assistance referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b).

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (3), the exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies under subsection (1),

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes not more than one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar month of calculation, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes at least two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar month of calculation.

subsection.subsectiontext: The exempt amount calculated under subsection (2) must not be greater than the difference between the exempt amount calculated under section 3 (2) of Schedule B and

paragraph.paragraphtext: $500, in the case of a family unit that includes not more than one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, or
$750, in the case of a family unit that includes at least two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7.1 (2.1), (3) (a.1) and (4) (b) (i.1) were added by BC Reg 332/2012, effective January 1, 2013.
Schedule B, section 7.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 226/2014, effective January 1, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), unearned income that is compensation paid under section 29 or 30 of the Workers Compensation Act is exempt for a family unit.

If an application for disability assistance (part 2) form is submitted to the minister, the family unit may not claim an exemption under this section in relation to the first calendar month for which the family unit becomes eligible for disability assistance unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a member of the family unit who is designated as a person with disabilities previously received disability assistance under the Act or a former Act, or
a member of the family unit received income assistance under the Employment and Assistance Act for the calendar month immediately preceding that first calendar month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A new family unit described in section 7.2 (4) (b), (5) (b), (11) (b) or (12 (b) that does not provide written notice to the minister in accordance with section 7.2 (4) (c), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c), as applicable, may claim an exemption under this section except in relation to the calendar month in which the new family unit forms.
Subject to subsection (4), the exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies under this section is to be calculated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar month of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar month of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar month of calculation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exempt amount calculated under subsection (3) must not be greater than the difference between

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount calculated under section 3 (3) of this Schedule, and
as applicable,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: $800, in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities,
$1 000, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, or
$1 600, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7.2 was added by BC Reg 332/2012, effective January 1, 2013.
Schedule B, section 7.2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 123/2013, effective March 20, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 7.1 but subject to this section, the amount of unearned income in a calendar year that is compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act, as calculated under subsection (2) of this section, is exempt for a family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit provides to the minister, on or before January 14 of the calendar year, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit in the calendar year,
a recipient in the family unit

clause.clausetext: is designated as a person with disabilities for the consecutive 12 calendar month period, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

is a recipient of disability assistance for the 2 calendar months, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: for at least one calendar month in the 12 calendar month period immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), the family unit reported, under section 29 of this regulation, compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act in an amount that exceeded

clause.clausetext: $500, in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, or
$750, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit provides to the minister, on or before January 14 of the calendar year, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit in the calendar year, and
an exemption under this section applied to compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit in the immediately preceding calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsections (4) to (17), the exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies for an exemption under this section is calculated as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year of calculation;

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year of calculation;

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, both of whom are designated as persons with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year of calculation.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite this section, if a family unit qualifies for an exemption under section 3.1 and under this section, the sum of the amount of

paragraph.paragraphtext: earned income of the family unit, and
total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit,

section.subsandwich: that is exempted, cannot exceed the exempt amount calculated for the family unit under s. 3.1.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,

includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities

clause.clausetext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

section.subparasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
only one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if the recipient described in paragraph (b) (ii)

clause.clausetext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

section.subparasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

clause.clausetext: the sum of

subclause.subclausetext: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

clause.clausetext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
each of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: if only one of the recipients in the new family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

section.parasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the sum of

clause.clausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient who separated, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient who did not separate, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

paragraph.paragraphtext: if each of the recipients in the new family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

section.parasandwich: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the sum of

clause.clausetext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which one of the recipient's separation occurred, minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the other recipient's separation occurred, minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B), respecting the recipient, for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

paragraph.paragraphtext: if paragraphs (c) and (d) do not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (c) (i) minus the sum of the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to each recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities,

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

section.parasandwich: minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit, that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (c) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (b), eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

section.parasandwich: minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit in the calendar months the family unit was, before the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (b), eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (b), eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit that includes only one recipient

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

section.parasandwich: minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit
