subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

clause.clausetext: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C), eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subparasandwich: minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of the following amounts:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms;

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred;

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

clause.clausetext: was eligible for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that did not qualify for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides to the minister, within the calendar month the new family unit forms, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

clause.clausetext: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subparasandwich: minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) was, before the forming of the new family unit, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the forming of the new family unit, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a new family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: forms during a calendar year,

includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and that recipient was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides to the minister, within the calendar month the new family unit forms, written notice that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit in the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

clause.clausetext: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iii) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred,

section.subparasandwich: minus the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iii) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which that event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: $200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit was eligible to receive disability assistance,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c), as applicable, in the case of the spouse who is not designated as a person with disabilities, is deemed to be cancelled;
the recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was ineligible, immediately before the separation, to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the recipient who is one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If

paragraph.paragraphtext: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was ineligible, immediately before the separation, to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: a recipient who is one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the following apply:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a family unit

paragraph.paragraphtext: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year, and
includes two recipients, one of whom becomes designated as a person with disabilities during the calendar year,

section.subsandwich: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the sum of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), minus the family unit's earned income in the calendar year, and

$600 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the family unit's earned income in the calendar months the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year.

subsection.subsectiontext: Notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c) is deemed not to have been provided unless the notice is affirmed by the signature of each recipient in the family unit.
If a family unit provides notice in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c) the family unit may not withdraw the notice.

If a family unit provides notice in accordance with a section set out in Column 1 of the following Table, the family unit is deemed to also provide notice in accordance with the section set out in Column 2 that corresponds with the entry in Column 1, if the family unit has not already provided notice in accordance with that section:

If subsection (20) applies to a notice provided in accordance with this section and that notice is subsequently deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 1 of the following Table, the notice in section 3.1 that was deemed to be provided in accordance with subsection (20) is deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 2:

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 7.2 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 226/2014, effective January 1, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 7.1 but subject to this section, the amount of unearned income in a calendar year that is compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act, as calculated under subsection (2) of this section, is exempt for a family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit provides written notice to the minister on or before January 14 of the calendar year that the exemption under this section applies to compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year,
a recipient in the family unit

bcl:clause.bcl:text: is designated as a person with disabilities for the consecutive 12 calendar month period, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

is a recipient of disability assistance for the 2 calendar months, or longer, immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: for at least one calendar month in the 12 calendar month period immediately preceding the calendar month in which the family unit provides notice in accordance with paragraph (a) (i), the family unit reported, under section 29 of this regulation, compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in an amount that exceeded

bcl:clause.bcl:text: $500, in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, or
$750, in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family unit provides written notice to the minister on or before January 14 of the calendar year that the exemption under this section applies to compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year, and
an exemption under this section applied to compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the immediately preceding calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (4) to (17), the exempt amount for a family unit that qualifies for an exemption under this section is calculated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes only one recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year of calculation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year of calculation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite this section, if a family unit qualifies for an exemption under section 3.1 and under this section, the sum of the amount of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: earned income of the family unit, and
total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: that is exempted, cannot exceed the exempt amount calculated for the family unit under section 3.1.
If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,

includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities

bcl:clause.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) and (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
only one of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c), or paragraph (c) of this subsection, as applicable, by the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) is deemed to be cancelled as of the day the new family unit forms;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the recipient described in paragraph (b) (ii)

bcl:clause.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in clause (A) of this subparagraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and
$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who are designated as persons with disabilities, and
each of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: included only one recipient, and
qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if only one of the recipients in the new family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient's separation occurred, minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to that recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which that recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the amount referred to in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the recipient who did not separate for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if each of the recipients in the new family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit immediately before the family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) (A) and (B) formed, and
was one of two spouses in the other family unit described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph who separated as set out in subsection (13) or (14),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: $800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which one of the recipient's separation occurred, minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to that recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which that recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the other recipient's separation occurred, minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to that recipient for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which that recipient's separation occurred and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if paragraphs (c) and (d) do not apply, the exempt amount is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount referred to in subsection (2) (c) (i) minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the recipients for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit forms and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit that includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit that includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (c) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit that includes only one recipient

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
subsequently became eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period the family unit is subsequently eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the calendar months the family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) occurred, and
for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurred and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year, and
includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: one of whom was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was, immediately before the new family unit formed, ineligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i) minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of the following amounts:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms;

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred;

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the other family unit described in paragraph (b) (ii) for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar year and ending on the first day of the calendar month in which the new family unit forms.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients who are designated as persons with disabilities,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: one of whom was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: was eligible for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was, immediately before the new family unit formed, ineligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the other of whom was, during the calendar year and immediately before the new family unit formed, part of another family unit that did not qualify for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, and

$800 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) (A) to (D) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (i) (C) occurred.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a new family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during a calendar year,
includes two recipients, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, and that recipient was, during the calendar year, part of another family unit that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
included only one recipient,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was, immediately before the new family unit formed, ineligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides written notice to the minister within the calendar month the new family unit forms that the exemption under this section applies to the compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit in the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the sum of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of calendar months the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and

the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: $200 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit in the calendar months the new family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the new family unit forms, and

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to the member of the family unit described in paragraph (b) (i) to (iv) in the calendar months that family unit was, before the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred, eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year, not including the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (b) (iii) occurred.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit, immediately before the separation, qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year, and
the separation occurs when the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c), as applicable, in the case of the person who was one of the spouses and is not designated as a person with disabilities, is deemed to be cancelled;
the recipient who was one of the spouses is, immediately after the separation, part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs, and

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the separation occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, only one of whom is designated as a person with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was ineligible, immediately before the separation, to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the recipient who was one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: spouses in a family unit, who are designated as persons with disabilities, separate during a calendar year,
the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: qualified for an exemption under this section for the calendar year,
ceased being eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and
was ineligible, immediately before the separation, to receive disability assistance during the calendar year, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a recipient who was one of the spouses subsequently becomes eligible to receive disability assistance during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the recipient is, on the occurrence of the event described in paragraph (c), part of a new family unit that includes only one recipient;
the exempt amount for the new family unit is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (a) (i), as prorated based on the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs, and

the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the new family unit for the period beginning on the first day of the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the event described in paragraph (c) occurs and ending on the last day of the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a family unit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: qualifies for an exemption under this section for a calendar year, and
includes two recipients, one of whom becomes designated as a person with disabilities during the calendar year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the exempt amount for the family unit, for the period beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, is calculated as the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount set out in subsection (2) (b) (i), minus the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar year, and

$600 multiplied by the number of calendar months remaining in the calendar year, beginning with the calendar month immediately following the calendar month in which the recipient becomes designated as a person with disabilities, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total compensation paid under sections 29 and 30 of the Workers Compensation Act to members of the family unit in the calendar months the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance in the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Notice provided in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c) is deemed not to have been provided unless the notice is affirmed by the signature of each recipient in the family unit.
If a family unit provides notice in accordance with subsection (1) (a) (i) or (b) (i), (4) (c), (5) (c), (11) (c) or (12) (c) the family unit may not cancel the notice.

If a family unit provides notice in accordance with a section set out in Column 1 of the following Table, the family unit is deemed to also provide notice in accordance with the section set out in Column 2 that corresponds with the entry in Column 1, if the family unit has not already provided notice in accordance with that section:

If subsection (20) applies to a notice provided in accordance with this section and that notice is subsequently deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 1 of the following Table, the notice in section 3.1 that was deemed to be provided in accordance with subsection (20) is deemed to be cancelled as set out in the section listed in Column 2:

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 8 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 145/2015, effective September 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister's discretion to exempt education related unearned income

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: day care costs means the difference between a student's actual day care costs and the maximum amount of child care subsidy that is available under the Child Care Subsidy Act to a family unit matching the student's family unit, for a semester;
education costs means the amount required by a student for tuition, books, compulsory student fees and reasonable transportation costs for a semester.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may authorize an exemption for a student up to the sum of the student's education costs and day care costs from the total amount of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a training allowance,
student financial assistance, and
student grants, bursaries, scholarships or disbursements from a registered education savings plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: received for the semester.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 8 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 204/2015, effective December 1, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may authorize an exemption for a student up to the sum of the student's education costs and day care costs, for a period of study, from the total amount of the following received by the student for the period of study:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a training allowance;
student financial assistance;
student grants, bursaries and scholarships;
disbursements from a registered education savings plan.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 10 (0.1) was added by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
Schedule B, section 10 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: If that portion of a child benefits cheque attributable to family bonus, the payee of which is a person in the applicant's or recipient's family unit, includes an amount attributable to family bonus for one or more calendar months preceding the calendar month in which the cheque was issued, the amount for each preceding calendar month must be treated as unearned income.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 10 (0.1) definition of "backdated Canada child benefit payment" was added by BC Reg 34/2017, effective July 1, 2017.
Schedule B, section 10 (0.1) definition of "supplement" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 34/2017, effective July 1, 2017.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: supplement means a supplement referred to in section 59 [supplement for delayed, suspended or cancelled family bonus] of this regulation.

change.changenote: Schedule B, section 10 (1), (2) and (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 34/2017, effective July 1, 2017.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person in the applicant's or recipient's family unit receives a backdated family bonus payment and all or part of the payment is attributable to one or more calendar months for which the family unit was also provided with a supplement, the lesser of the following amounts must be treated as unearned income:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the portion of the backdated family bonus payment that is attributable to those calendar months for which the family unit was provided with a supplement;
the sum of the supplements that are attributable to those calendar months for which the family unit received the backdated family bonus payment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), an amount that, under the Income Tax Act (British Columbia) or the Income Tax Act (Canada), is deducted or set off from a family bonus is considered to have been paid to a person in the applicant's or recipient's family unit.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an amount included in that portion of a child benefits cheque attributable to family bonus

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to replace a lost or stolen cheque for which an amount was advanced under section 58 [advance for lost or stolen family bonus cheque] of this regulation, or

to replace a cheque for which no amount was advanced under section 58 [advance for lost or stolen family bonus cheque] of this regulation if the replacement is received in the calendar month following the calendar month for which the lost or stolen cheque was issued.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 48/2010, Sch. 1, s. 2 (d).]

change.changenote: Schedule C, section 3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 61/2010, effective April 1, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: The following medical equipment and devices are the health supplements that may be paid for by the minister if the supplements are provided to a family unit that is eligible under section 62 [general health supplements] of this regulation:

paragraph.paragraphtext: wheelchairs, personal motorized mobility devices, canes, crutches and walkers, if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 317/2008, s. 10 (e).]
medically essential for basic mobility,
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 317/2008, s. 10 (e).]
the person has received the pre-authorization of the minister for the medical equipment or device requested, and
there are no resources available to the person's family unit to pay the cost of the health supplement;

paragraph.paragraphtext: orthotics and bracing if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: prescribed by a medical practitioner or podiatrist, or an occupational therapist or physical therapist has performed an assessment and confirmed the need for the orthotics or bracing,
medically essential for basic mobility,
the person has received the pre-authorization of the minister for the orthotics or bracing requested,
the minister is satisfied that the orthotics or bracing are required for one or more of the following purposes:

clause.clausetext: to prevent surgery;
for post-surgical care;
to assist in physical healing from surgery, injury or disease;
to improve physical functioning that has been impaired by a neuro-musculo-skeletal condition,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: there are no resources available to the person's family unit to pay for the cost of the health supplement, and
the orthotics or bracing are pre-fabricated, unless

clause.clausetext: a medical practitioner, occupational therapist, physical therapist, podiatrist or orthotist confirms that custom-made orthotics or bracing are required for one or more of the reasons referred to in subparagraph (iv), and
the minister is satisfied that custom-made orthotics or bracing are required for one or more of the reasons referred to in subparagraph (iv);

paragraph.paragraphtext: hearing instruments, if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: prescribed by an audiologist or hearing aid dealer and consultant,
an audiologist or hearing aid dealer and consultant has performed an assessment that confirms the need for the hearing aid,
the person has received the pre-authorization of the minister for the hearing instrument, and
there are no resources available to the person's family unit to pay the cost of the health supplement;

paragraph.paragraphtext: positioning devices, if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 317/2008, s. 10 (e).]
the person has received the pre-authorization of the minister for the positioning device requested, and
there are no resources available to the person's family unit to pay the cost of the health supplement;

paragraph.paragraphtext: breathing devices, if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: prescribed by a medical practitioner,
a respiratory therapist has performed an assessment that confirms the type of breathing device required,
the person has received the pre-authorization of the minister for the breathing device, and
there are no resources available to the person's family unit to pay the cost of the health supplement.

subsection.subsectiontext: In addition to the requirements of subsection (1) (a) or (d), the minister must require one, and may require both, of the following:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a prescription of a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner for the wheelchair, personal motorized mobility device, cane, crutches, walker or positioning device;
an assessment by an occupational therapist or physical therapist confirming the need for the wheelchair, personal motorized mobility device, cane, crutches, walker or positioning device.

change.changenote: Schedule C, section 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsections (2) to (5) of this section, the medical equipment and devices described in sections 3.1 to 3.11 of this Schedule are the health supplements that may be provided by the minister if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the supplements are provided to a family unit that is eligible under section 62 [general health supplements] of this regulation, and
all of the following requirements are met:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the family unit has received the pre-authorization of the minister for the medical equipment or device requested;
there are no resources available to the family unit to pay the cost of or obtain the medical equipment or device;
the medical equipment or device is the least expensive appropriate medical equipment or device.

subsection.subsectiontext: For medical equipment or devices referred to in sections 3.1 to 3.8, in addition to the requirements in those sections and subsection (1) of this section, the family unit must provide to the minister one or both of the following, as requested by the minister:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a prescription of a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner for the medical equipment or device;
an assessment by an occupational therapist or physical therapist confirming the medical need for the medical equipment or device.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (6), the minister may provide as a health supplement a replacement of medical equipment or a medical device, previously provided by the minister under this section, that is damaged, worn out or not functioning if

paragraph.paragraphtext: it is more economical to replace than to repair the medical equipment or device previously provided by the minister, and
the period of time, if any, set out in sections 3.1 to 3.11 of this Schedule, as applicable, for the purposes of this paragraph, has passed.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (6), the minister may provide as a health supplement repairs of medical equipment or a medical device that was previously provided by the minister if it is more economical to repair the medical equipment or device than to replace it.
Subject to subsection (6), the minister may provide as a health supplement repairs of medical equipment or a medical device that was not previously provided by the minister if

paragraph.paragraphtext: at the time of the repairs the requirements in this section and section 3.1 to 3.11 of this Schedule, as applicable, are met in respect of the medical equipment or device being repaired, and
it is more economical to repair the medical equipment or device than to replace it.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister may not provide a replacement of medical equipment or a medical device under subsection (3) or repairs of medical equipment or a medical device under subsection (4) or (5) if the minister considers that the medical equipment or device was damaged through misuse.

section.sectiontext: If the criteria in section 3 (1) (b) (vi) (A) and (B) are met and the orthotic is a custom-made foot orthotic, the foot orthotic must be made from a hand-cast mold.

Schedule C, section 3.9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

section.marginalnote: Medical equipment and devices — positive airway pressure devices

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (4) of this section, the following items are health supplements for the purposes of section 3 of this Schedule if all of the requirements set out in subsection (2) of this section are met:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a positive airway pressure device;
an accessory that is required to operate a positive airway pressure device;
a supply that is required to operate a positive airway pressure device.

subsection.subsectiontext: The following are the requirements in relation to an item referred to in subsection (1) of this section:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the item is prescribed by a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner;
a respiratory therapist has performed an assessment that confirms the medical need for the item;
the minister is satisfied that the item is medically essential for the treatment of moderate to severe sleep apnea.

subsection.subsectiontext: The period of time referred to in section 3 (3) (b) of this Schedule with respect to replacement of an item described in subsection (1) of this section is

paragraph.paragraphtext: 5 years from the date on which the minister provided the item being replaced, for an item described in subsection (1) (a), and
1 year from the date on which the minister provided the item being replaced, for an item described in subsection (1) (b) or (c).

section.marginalnote: Medical equipment and devices — hearing aids
section.sectiontext: A hearing aid is a health supplement for the purposes of section 3 of this Schedule if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the hearing aid is prescribed by an audiologist or hearing aid dealer or consultant, and
an audiologist or hearing aid dealer or consultant has performed an assessment that confirms the need for a hearing aid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Medical equipment and devices — hearing instruments
bcl:section.bcl:text: A hearing instrument is a health supplement for the purposes of section 3 of this Schedule if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the hearing instrument is prescribed by an audiologist or hearing instrument practitioner, and
an audiologist or hearing instrument practitioner has performed an assessment that confirms the need for a hearing instrument.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the applicant's family unit includes one or more dependent children, the support allowance for the family may be adjusted as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: for each dependent child, by an additional $123.50 for the calendar month in which the dependent child is born;
for each dependent child in the family unit and for whom a person in the family is entitled to the BC basic family bonus, by the result of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the amount of the family bonus payable to the person for that dependent child for the calendar month preceding the calendar month for which the allowance is paid;

paragraph.paragraphtext: for each dependent child who has reached 18 years of age,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: for the calendar month following the calendar month in which the dependent child reached that age, by the result of $123.50 minus the amount of family bonus payable to a person in the family unit for that dependent child for the calendar month in which the dependent child reached that age, and
for each subsequent calendar month, by an additional $123.50.

change.changenote: Schedule D, section 2 (3), (4) and (7) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 197/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: In calculating the adjustment under subsection (2) (b) or (c) (i), an amount that, under the Income Tax Act (British Columbia) or the Income Tax Act (Canada), is deducted or set off from the family bonus must be treated as if it was paid to a person in the family unit.
The support allowance under Table 1 may not be increased under subsection (2) (b) or (c) (i) if

paragraph.paragraphtext: payment of the family bonus for the preceding calendar month is delayed or suspended for any of the reasons listed in section 59 [advance for delayed or suspended family bonus] of this regulation, or
a person in the family unit refuses to accept or apply for the family bonus for the preceding calendar month.

subsection.subsectiontext: If that portion of a child benefits cheque attributable to family bonus, the payee of which is a person in the applicant's family unit, includes an amount attributable to family bonus, for one or more calendar months preceding the calendar month in which the cheque was issued, the amount for each preceding calendar month must be treated as unearned income in determining the family unit's net income under subsection (1) (b).

bcl:definition.bcl:text: maximum adjustment, in relation to a family unit, means the amount the family unit would receive for a calendar month as the national child benefit supplement if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the family unit were entitled to receive the national child benefit supplement for the calendar month,
the income of the family unit, for the purposes of calculating the national child benefit supplement, were zero, and
all dependent children in the family unit were qualified dependants within the meaning of the Income Tax Act (Canada);

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In calculating the adjustment under subsection (2), an amount that, under the Income Tax Act (British Columbia) or the Income Tax Act (Canada), is deducted or set off from the family bonus must be treated as if it were paid to a person in the family unit.
The support allowance under Table 1 for a calendar month may not be increased under subsection (2) if a person in the family unit refuses to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: apply for the family bonus for the preceding calendar month, or
accept the family bonus for the preceding calendar month

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: in respect of a dependent child in the family unit who is, or may be, a qualified dependant within the meaning of the Income Tax Act (Canada).

If a person in the applicant's or recipient's family unit receives a backdated family bonus payment and all or part of the payment is attributable to one or more calendar months for which the family unit was also provided with a supplement, the lesser of the following amounts must be treated as unearned income:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the portion of the backdated family bonus payment that is attributable to those calendar months for which the family unit was provided with a supplement;
the sum of the supplements that are attributable to those calendar months for which the family unit received the backdated family bonus payment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (7), an amount that, under the Income Tax Act (British Columbia) or the Income Tax Act (Canada), is deducted or set off from a family bonus must be treated as paid to a person in the applicant's family unit.
Subsection (7) does not apply to an amount included in that portion of a child benefits cheque attributable to family bonus

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to replace a lost or stolen cheque for which an amount was advanced under section 58 [advance for lost or stolen family bonus cheque] of this regulation, or

to replace a cheque for which no amount was advanced under section 58 [advance for lost or stolen family bonus cheque] of this regulation if the replacement is received in the calendar month following the calendar month for which the lost or stolen cheque was issued.

money that is paid or is payable to or for a person from a settlement under an agreement to settle claims relating to the transfer of the Seabird Island Indian Reserve in 1959 by the Government of Canada to the Seabird Island Band and the distribution of shared trust funds on a per capita basis;
